div.div: Keeps up with the U.S. NSF / DARPA future project proposals, and the EU / DFG / BMBF calls that follow 1-2 yrs afterwards. Knows what the next hot research fields are going to be, and the topics that will die out soon

switch.text: Keeps up with the U.S. NSF / DARPA future project pr...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 568px; height: 1px; padding-top: 462px; margin-left: 237px;

div.div: Monitors the top 20 professors in the field that supervise most of the papers at the top conferences, sets up Google alert notifications when their publications webpages' are updated

switch.text: Monitors the top 20 professors in the field that sup...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 568px; height: 1px; padding-top: 632px; margin-left: 237px;

display: inline-block; font-size: 22px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: Watches the B+ - A* conferences in the field and its subdomains, and has a map of their usual deadlines, and top publications. Can filter "actual" good papers from "noise", or low-quality research, i.e., reads only the top 20%

switch.text: Watches the B+ - A* conferences in the field and its...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 568px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1022px; margin-left: 237px;

div.div: Has read the top 10% of the SoK papers covering the past 5-7 years, and books that have classified the past top papers, set up a widely accepted terminology by the reseach community, and paved the roadmap for the future.

switch.text: Has read the top 10% of the SoK papers covering the...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 568px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1167px; margin-left: 237px;

display: inline-block; font-size: 22px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: Disorriented, lost and overhwhelmed with all the papers out there. Switches topics often whenever he/she/they learn something "cool" from a paper that they read

div.span: Maintains own literature classification, and a tailor-made paper collection is in hand. Knows where to look for related work, and is able to critique it. ;-)
